Empires & Puzzles Jequn Review: The Cosmic Enigma or Just an Old Puzzle?

Jequn burst onto the scene in 2022 as a Very Fast menace, hitting everyone and debuffing everything. But in the era of 1300+ Defense stats, is his 'Archaic Sacred Symbol' actually archaic? We break down if this Monk still has the punch to compete or if he's just a glorified tile-booster.
Jequn Review: Still Solving Puzzles or Missing a Piece?
Jequn: The Cosmic Enigma or Just an Old Puzzle?

Jequn, the "Cosmic Enigma," arrived in Empires & Puzzles back in October 2022 as part of the Super Elemental family. At the time, a Very Fast hero who hit all enemies was a terrifying concept—a speed demon designed to soften up entire teams before they could blink. Fast forward to late 2025, and the game landscape has shifted tectonically. While his mechanics remain interesting, Jequn now faces the harsh reality of aging stats in a world of power creep.
of Jequn. If you are looking for the review of his Gilded costume, check our separate guide.

Jequn’s design screams "cosmic serenity meets devastating power." Floating in a meditative pose with glowing golden gauntlets and a crown that looks like it receives 5G signals from another galaxy, he definitely stands out. The art perfectly captures his "Monk" class—calm, composed, and ready to withstand status ailments. Compared to his flashy "Gilded" costume, the original art feels more grounded in the mystic lore of the Super Elementals, emphasizing his role as a manipulator of elements rather than just a shiny golden warrior. It’s a classic look that has aged better than his defense stat.
Let’s be brutally honest: by modern standards (late 2025), Jequn’s base stats are dusty.
This was impressive in 2022. Today, with modern attackers boasting 1300+ attack, Jequn hits like a wet noodle without significant boosts.

These survivability stats are his biggest liability. Modern snipers can often one-shot heroes with less than 1200 defense. Jequn is incredibly fragile in the current meta, meaning he often dies before utilizing his "Very Fast" speed more than once.
is a toolbox of debuffs wrapped in a modest damage package.
200% to all enemies is simply not enough to threaten modern teams. Against modern defenses with 1500+ defense, this will barely scratch the paint.
This is where his value lies.
A decent blind, but niche since you rarely bring Yellows against Dark defenses in raids (due to color reflect risks or just standard weak color mechanics, though neutral in raids).
Excellent for Titan teams or attacking Blue tanks.

these effects; you only get the one matching the enemy's element. This makes him a "jack of all trades, master of none" in rainbow raids, though highly effective in specific counter-picking scenarios.

Family Bonus, Passives, Aether Power & Unique Abilities
The Super Elemental family brings unique mechanics that define Jequn's utility.

mechanic is excellent for mono-yellow or heavy-yellow teams. Every few turns (or based on matches), regular shields turn into Power Gems that deal damage (20 per gem) to enemies each turn. It’s free chip damage that ignores defense. While 20 damage sounds low, 5 gems over 5 turns is 500 free damage distributed across the enemy team.
His troops deal +100% extra damage to Dark enemies. This makes him a tile-damage monster against Purple Titans or Tanks.
He takes -10% damage from Dark troops. A small survival boost, but given his low base defense, it barely helps.
At the start of the battle, he gets a counterattack buff for 6 turns.
This is actually counter-intuitive for him. He has low health and defense; you don't
him taking hits to reflect damage, because he'll just die. A defensive buff or Dodge (like his costume has) would have been much better.
When Jequn released, he was a top-tier flank. His speed disrupted the slower meta, and his stats were competitive. He was a staple in many defenses.
The game has left him behind. Heroes like
, or newer Construct heroes do what he does but with 400-500% damage or better utility.
Base Jequn is no longer viable in top-tier Diamond Arena raids or Wars as a primary damage dealer. He serves a niche role in
(ironically, despite being Very Fast, the debuffs help) or as a
for the defense down vs Blue Titans (if you lack other options) or tile damage vs Purple Titans.

is a study in necessary modernization.
The Costume adds massive stats (Attack ~1213 vs 951). This alone makes the costume superior.

to use the Base version if you have the Costume, unless you desperately need the Monk class to resist a specific ailment (like mindless attack) and don't have the Rogue dodge luck. The Costume's stats are simply required to survive 2025 damage outputs.
If you are stuck using Base Jequn, you must protect him.
Attempts to patch his paper-thin defense. Might survive one hit from a sniper.

. His damage is negligible regardless of emblems; his utility comes from firing his special to apply debuffs. He needs to live long enough to get 6 tiles.
Charges in 6 tiles (3 ghosted). Can often fire before the enemy creates a strong board.
The passive +100% elemental damage makes him a strong tile hitter against Dark enemies.
-34% Defense against Ice makes him a decent tech choice against heavy Blue teams if you lack better Green options.
Chance to resist mana stops or silence is always valuable.
His defense and HP are critically low for the modern era.
200% hit-all is often shrugged off by modern healers and minions.
If you bring him against a Holy or Dark team, his specific elemental debuffs (Defense/Attack down) might not trigger on the targets you care about.
Counterattack on a squishy hero is a poor synergy.
For the Defense Down (if you don't have a better Blue-Def-Down hero).
His Very Fast speed allows him to fire often, though he doesn't provide buffs himself, his speed is an asset.
Very Fast AoE is always good for clearing waves quickly.
Mielikki - Jequn - Guardian Jackal - Vivica - Ranvir
Jequn maximizes tile damage against Purple Titans.
Use Jequn to apply Defense Down to blue enemies before hitting them with your main snipers. (Though usually, you'd want Green heroes for this, Jequn can flex if you are short on roster depth).
Jequn hits everyone, but if a Taunt is up, he hits only the tank. 200% damage on a Taunt hero is laughable.
Any healer that cleanses (Rigard, Vivica) wipes out Jequn's main contribution (the debuffs) instantly.

If you pulled Jequn early, congratulations! He will be a campaign clearing machine. His Very Fast speed teaches you the value of ghosting tiles (matching 3 into an empty lane generates double mana). Prioritize leveling him as your main farmer and raid attacker until you reach Platinum arena.
Jequn is likely a bench warmer for you unless you have his costume. Base Jequn serves only one purpose for a veteran:
where you need deep rosters. Do not Limit Break (LB1 or LB2) the base version unless you have the costume and are boosting stats for that.
Back in 2022, the community was divided. Some called him "Over Powered" due to the Very Fast speed.
"200% to all with one ghosted match... Just when you think heroes can’t get more OP."

- Recent YouTube Comment.
The shift from "OP" to "Needs Buff" perfectly encapsulates the speed of power creep in Empires & Puzzles.

Jequn is a hero who lived fast and aged fast. In his prime, he was a cosmic force; now, he's more of a cosmic background radiation—present, but faint. Without his costume, he struggles to make an impact in competitive play due to fragile stats and low damage output. However, his
passive keeps him employed on Titan teams, ensuring he hasn't completely faded into the void.
A retired star. Keep him for Titans, but look for the Costume if you want to bring him back to the battlefield.
